alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 2:33PM CDT until April 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 206, 209, 210, AND 219... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ TO 7 PM CDT /6 PM MDT/ WEDNESDAY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 206, 209, 210, AND 219... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM CDT /noon MDT/ to 7 PM CDT /6 PM MDT/ Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 204. Fire weather zone 206. Fire weather zone 208. Fire weather zone 209. Fire weather zone 210. Fire weather zone 219. * WINDS...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph for the Red Flag Warning through this evening. South winds 15 to 25 with gusts up to 35 mph for the Red Flag Warning that is in effect Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent this evening and as low as 15 percent for Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly and will be difficult to control. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Loup Rivers Basin; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest
